entity.entitySummary: Stores information linking a party to a name-circumscription relationship.
entity.entityDescription:
The nameUsage table is a 3 way intersection between party, name and circumscription, which basically tracks how a party applies a circumscription to a name over time. The acceptence attribute is a relatively new addition and is domain locked to the values 'standard' and 'accepted'. Name_Usage.acceptance refers to acceptance of a name by a party. Both "A" (accepted) and "S" (standard) mean that according to the party, the name points to the circumscription indicated. In addition if the value is "S", then this is the name that the party assigns to the referenced circumscription. At one time in the perspective of a party here can be many names with an "A" relative to a single circumscription, but there can be only one "S".
Status.status refers to acceptance of a circumscription by a party. The taxonomy of a party at a given time should be devised so that a given organism can belong to only one standard ("S") circumscription; any others that include the organisms must be indicated to be nponstandard ("N"), or can be absent from the status table altogether.
